trans-unit.source: Elastic database jobs overview
trans-unit.target: Elastic database jobs overview

trans-unit.source: Illustrates the elastic database job service
trans-unit.target: Illustrates the elastic database job service

trans-unit.source: Elastic Database jobs overview
trans-unit.target: Elastic Database jobs overview

trans-unit.source: TThe **Elastic Database jobs** feature (preview) enables you to reliably execute a Transact-SQL (T-SQL) script or apply a DACPAC across a group of databases including a custom-defined collection of databases, all databases in an [Elastic Database pool (preview)](sql-database-elastic-pool.md) or a shard set (created using [Elastic Database client library](sql-database-elastic-database-client-library.md)).
trans-unit.target: TThe **Elastic Database jobs** feature (preview) enables you to reliably execute a Transact-SQL (T-SQL) script or apply a DACPAC across a group of databases including a custom-defined collection of databases, all databases in an [Elastic Database pool (preview)](sql-database-elastic-pool.md) or a shard set (created using [Elastic Database client library](sql-database-elastic-database-client-library.md)).

trans-unit.source: In preview, **Elastic Database jobs** is currently a customer-hosted Azure Cloud Service that enables the execution of ad-hoc and scheduled administrative tasks, which are called jobs.
trans-unit.target: In preview, **Elastic Database jobs** is currently a customer-hosted Azure Cloud Service that enables the execution of ad-hoc and scheduled administrative tasks, which are called jobs.

trans-unit.source: Using this feature, you can easily and reliably manage Azure SQL Database at scale across an entire group of databases by running Transact-SQL scripts to perform administrative operations such as schema changes, credentials management, reference data updates, performance data collection or tenant (customer) telemetry collection.
trans-unit.target: Using this feature, you can easily and reliably manage Azure SQL Database at scale across an entire group of databases by running Transact-SQL scripts to perform administrative operations such as schema changes, credentials management, reference data updates, performance data collection or tenant (customer) telemetry collection.

trans-unit.source: Normally, you must connect to each database independently in order to run Transact-SQL statements or perform other administrative tasks.
trans-unit.target: Normally, you must connect to each database independently in order to run Transact-SQL statements or perform other administrative tasks.

trans-unit.source: **Elastic Database jobs** handle the task of logging in, and reliably running the script, while logging the status of execution for each database.
trans-unit.target: **Elastic Database jobs** handle the task of logging in, and reliably running the script, while logging the status of execution for each database.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on installation, go to [Installing the Elastic Database job components](sql-database-elastic-jobs-service-installation.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on installation, go to [Installing the Elastic Database job components](sql-database-elastic-jobs-service-installation.md).

trans-unit.source: ![Elastic database job service][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Elastic database job service][1]

trans-unit.source: Benefits
trans-unit.target: Benefits

trans-unit.source: Define custom groups of Azure SQL Databases
trans-unit.target: Define custom groups of Azure SQL Databases

trans-unit.source: Define, maintain and persist Transact-SQL scripts to be executed across a group of Azure SQL Databases
trans-unit.target: Define, maintain and persist Transact-SQL scripts to be executed across a group of Azure SQL Databases

trans-unit.source: Deploy a data-tier application (DACPAC)
trans-unit.target: Deploy a data-tier application (DACPAC)

trans-unit.source: Execute Transact-SQL scripts or application of DACPACs reliably with automatic retry and at scale
trans-unit.target: Execute Transact-SQL scripts or application of DACPACs reliably with automatic retry and at scale

trans-unit.source: Track job execution state
trans-unit.target: Track job execution state

trans-unit.source: Define execution schedules
trans-unit.target: Define execution schedules

trans-unit.source: Perform data collection across a collection of Azure SQL Databases saving the results into a single destination table
trans-unit.target: Perform data collection across a collection of Azure SQL Databases saving the results into a single destination table

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] **Elastic Database jobs** functionality in the Azure portal surfaces a reduced feature set also limited to SQL Azure elastic pools.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] **Elastic Database jobs** functionality in the Azure portal surfaces a reduced feature set also limited to SQL Azure elastic pools.

trans-unit.source: Use the PowerShell APIs to access the full set of current functionality.
trans-unit.target: Use the PowerShell APIs to access the full set of current functionality.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Scenarios

trans-unit.source: Performance administrative task, such as deploy new schema
trans-unit.target: Performance administrative task, such as deploy new schema

trans-unit.source: Update reference data, for example product information common across all databases, even using schedules to automate the updates every weekday after hours.
trans-unit.target: Update reference data, for example product information common across all databases, even using schedules to automate the updates every weekday after hours.

trans-unit.source: Rebuild indexes to improve query performance.
trans-unit.target: Rebuild indexes to improve query performance.

trans-unit.source: The rebuilding can be configured to execute across a collection of databases on a recurring basis, such as during off-peak hours.
trans-unit.target: The rebuilding can be configured to execute across a collection of databases on a recurring basis, such as during off-peak hours.

trans-unit.source: Collect query results from a set of databases into a central table on an on-going basis.
trans-unit.target: Collect query results from a set of databases into a central table on an on-going basis.

trans-unit.source: Performance queries can be continually executed and configured to trigger additional tasks to be executed.
trans-unit.target: Performance queries can be continually executed and configured to trigger additional tasks to be executed.

trans-unit.source: Execute longer running data processing queries across a large set of databases, for example the collection of customer telemetry.
trans-unit.target: Execute longer running data processing queries across a large set of databases, for example the collection of customer telemetry.

trans-unit.source: Results are collected into a single destination table for further analysis.
trans-unit.target: Results are collected into a single destination table for further analysis.

trans-unit.source: Simple end-to-end review of Elastic Database jobs
trans-unit.target: Simple end-to-end review of Elastic Database jobs

trans-unit.source: Install the **Elastic Database jobs** components.
trans-unit.target: Install the **Elastic Database jobs** components.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Installing Elastic Database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-service-installation.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Installing Elastic Database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-service-installation.md).

trans-unit.source: If the installation fails, see [how to uninstall](sql-database-elastic-jobs-uninstall.md).
trans-unit.target: If the installation fails, see [how to uninstall](sql-database-elastic-jobs-uninstall.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the PowerShell APIs to access more functionality, for example creating custom-defined database collections, adding schedules and/or gathering results sets.
trans-unit.target: Use the PowerShell APIs to access more functionality, for example creating custom-defined database collections, adding schedules and/or gathering results sets.

trans-unit.source: Use the Portal for simple installation and creation/monitoring of jobs limited to execution against a **Elastic Database pool**.
trans-unit.target: Use the Portal for simple installation and creation/monitoring of jobs limited to execution against a **Elastic Database pool**.

trans-unit.source: Create encrypted credentials for job execution and [add the user (or role) to each database in the group](sql-database-elastic-jobs-add-logins-to-dbs.md).
trans-unit.target: Create encrypted credentials for job execution and [add the user (or role) to each database in the group](sql-database-elastic-jobs-add-logins-to-dbs.md).

trans-unit.source: Create an idempotent T-SQL script that can be run against every database in the group.
trans-unit.target: Create an idempotent T-SQL script that can be run against every database in the group.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to run the script: [Creating and managing Elastic Database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-create-and-manage.md)
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to run the script: [Creating and managing Elastic Database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-create-and-manage.md)

trans-unit.source: Components and pricing
trans-unit.target: Components and pricing

trans-unit.source: The following components work together to create an Azure Cloud service that enables ad-hoc execution of administrative jobs.
trans-unit.target: The following components work together to create an Azure Cloud service that enables ad-hoc execution of administrative jobs.

trans-unit.source: The components are installed and configured automatically during setup, in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: The components are installed and configured automatically during setup, in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can identify the services as they all have the same auto-generated name.
trans-unit.target: You can identify the services as they all have the same auto-generated name.

trans-unit.source: The name is unique, and consists of the prefix "edj" followed by 21 randomly generated characters.
trans-unit.target: The name is unique, and consists of the prefix "edj" followed by 21 randomly generated characters.

trans-unit.source: **Azure Cloud Service**: elastic database jobs (preview) is delivered as a customer-hosted Azure Cloud service to perform execution of the requested tasks.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Cloud Service**: elastic database jobs (preview) is delivered as a customer-hosted Azure Cloud service to perform execution of the requested tasks.

trans-unit.source: From the portal, the service is deployed and hosted in your Microsoft Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: From the portal, the service is deployed and hosted in your Microsoft Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: The default deployed service runs with the minimum of two worker roles for high availability.
trans-unit.target: The default deployed service runs with the minimum of two worker roles for high availability.

trans-unit.source: The default size of each worker role (ElasticDatabaseJobWorker) runs on an A0 instance.
trans-unit.target: The default size of each worker role (ElasticDatabaseJobWorker) runs on an A0 instance.

trans-unit.source: For pricing, see [Cloud services pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/cloud-services/).
trans-unit.target: For pricing, see [Cloud services pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/cloud-services/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure SQL Database**: The service uses an Azure SQL Database known as the **control database** to store all of the job metadata.
trans-unit.target: **Azure SQL Database**: The service uses an Azure SQL Database known as the **control database** to store all of the job metadata.

trans-unit.source: The default service tier is a S0.
trans-unit.target: The default service tier is a S0.

trans-unit.source: For pricing, see [SQL Database Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/sql-database/).
trans-unit.target: For pricing, see [SQL Database Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/sql-database/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure Service Bus**: An Azure Service Bus is for coordination of the work within the Azure Cloud Service.
trans-unit.target: **Azure Service Bus**: An Azure Service Bus is for coordination of the work within the Azure Cloud Service.

trans-unit.source: See [Service Bus Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/service-bus/).
trans-unit.target: See [Service Bus Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/service-bus/).

trans-unit.source: **Azure Storage**: An Azure Storage account is used to store diagnostic output logging in the event that an issue requires further debugging (a common practice for [Azure diagnostics](../cloud-services-dotnet-diagnostics.md)).
trans-unit.target: **Azure Storage**: An Azure Storage account is used to store diagnostic output logging in the event that an issue requires further debugging (a common practice for [Azure diagnostics](../cloud-services-dotnet-diagnostics.md)).

trans-unit.source: For pricing, see [Azure Storage Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/).
trans-unit.target: For pricing, see [Azure Storage Pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/storage/).

trans-unit.source: How Elastic Database jobs work
trans-unit.target: How Elastic Database jobs work

trans-unit.source: An Azure SQL Database is designated a control database which stores all meta-data and state data.
trans-unit.target: An Azure SQL Database is designated a control database which stores all meta-data and state data.

trans-unit.source: The control database is accessed by **Elastic Database jobs** to both launch and track jobs to execute.
trans-unit.target: The control database is accessed by **Elastic Database jobs** to both launch and track jobs to execute.

trans-unit.source: Two different roles communicate with the control database:
trans-unit.target: Two different roles communicate with the control database:

trans-unit.source: Controller: Determines which jobs require tasks to perform the requested job, and retries failed jobs by creating new job tasks.
trans-unit.target: Controller: Determines which jobs require tasks to perform the requested job, and retries failed jobs by creating new job tasks.

trans-unit.source: Job Task Execution: Carries out the job tasks.
trans-unit.target: Job Task Execution: Carries out the job tasks.

trans-unit.source: Job task types
trans-unit.target: Job task types

trans-unit.source: There are multiple types of job tasks that carry out execution of jobs:
trans-unit.target: There are multiple types of job tasks that carry out execution of jobs:

trans-unit.source: ShardMapRefresh: Queries the shard map to determine all the databases used as shards
trans-unit.target: ShardMapRefresh: Queries the shard map to determine all the databases used as shards

trans-unit.source: ScriptSplit: Splits the script across ‘GO’ statements into batches
trans-unit.target: ScriptSplit: Splits the script across ‘GO’ statements into batches

trans-unit.source: ExpandJob: Creates child jobs for each database from a job that targets a group of databases
trans-unit.target: ExpandJob: Creates child jobs for each database from a job that targets a group of databases

trans-unit.source: ScriptExecution: Executes a script against a particular database using defined credentials
trans-unit.target: ScriptExecution: Executes a script against a particular database using defined credentials

trans-unit.source: Dacpac: Applies a DACPAC to a particular database using particular credentials
trans-unit.target: Dacpac: Applies a DACPAC to a particular database using particular credentials

trans-unit.source: End-to-End job execution work-flow
trans-unit.target: End-to-End job execution work-flow

trans-unit.source: Using either the Portal or the PowerShell API, a job is inserted into the **control database**.
trans-unit.target: Using either the Portal or the PowerShell API, a job is inserted into the **control database**.

trans-unit.source: The job requests execution of a Transact-SQL script against a group of databases using specific credentials.
trans-unit.target: The job requests execution of a Transact-SQL script against a group of databases using specific credentials.

trans-unit.source: The controller identifies the new job.
trans-unit.target: The controller identifies the new job.

trans-unit.source: Job tasks are created and executed to split the script and to refresh the group’s databases.
trans-unit.target: Job tasks are created and executed to split the script and to refresh the group’s databases.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, a new job is created and executed to expand the job and create new child jobs where each child job is specified to execute the Transact-SQL script against an individual database in the group.
trans-unit.target: Lastly, a new job is created and executed to expand the job and create new child jobs where each child job is specified to execute the Transact-SQL script against an individual database in the group.

trans-unit.source: The controller identifies the created child jobs.
trans-unit.target: The controller identifies the created child jobs.

trans-unit.source: For each job, the controller creates and triggers a job task to execute the script against a database.
trans-unit.target: For each job, the controller creates and triggers a job task to execute the script against a database.

trans-unit.source: After all job tasks have completed, the controller updates the jobs to a completed state.
trans-unit.target: After all job tasks have completed, the controller updates the jobs to a completed state.

trans-unit.source: At any point during job execution, the PowerShell API can be used to view the current state of job execution.
trans-unit.target: At any point during job execution, the PowerShell API can be used to view the current state of job execution.

trans-unit.source: All times returned by the PowerShell APIs are represented in UTC.
trans-unit.target: All times returned by the PowerShell APIs are represented in UTC.

trans-unit.source: If desired, a cancellation request can be initiated to stop a job.
trans-unit.target: If desired, a cancellation request can be initiated to stop a job.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: [Install the components](sql-database-elastic-jobs-service-installation.md), then [create and add a log in to each database in the group of databases](sql-database-elastic-jobs-add-logins-to-dbs.md).
trans-unit.target: [Install the components](sql-database-elastic-jobs-service-installation.md), then [create and add a log in to each database in the group of databases](sql-database-elastic-jobs-add-logins-to-dbs.md).

trans-unit.source: To further understand job creation and management, see [creating and managing elastic database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-create-and-manage.md).
trans-unit.target: To further understand job creation and management, see [creating and managing elastic database jobs](sql-database-elastic-jobs-create-and-manage.md).
